desmoj.extensions.xml.util

Class XMLHelper

  • java.lang.Object
    • desmoj.extensions.xml.util.XMLHelper

  • public class XMLHelper
extends java.lang.Object
    A utility class providing several static methods to handle DOM documents.

        Writes a DOM node (and all its ancestors) to the given output stream

      • createElement

        public static org.w3c.dom.Element createElement(org.w3c.dom.Document d,
                                                java.lang.String name)
        Creates a DOM element node with the given name. This node must only be used in the specified document.
        Parameters:
        d - the "mother" document of the created node
        name - the name of the node
        Returns:
        a node with the given name

      • createComment

        public static org.w3c.dom.Comment createComment(org.w3c.dom.Document d,
                                                java.lang.String text)
        Creates an XML comment with the given text
        Parameters:
        d - the "mother" document of the created comment
        text - the comment text
        Returns:
        a comment containing the given text

      • createText

        public static org.w3c.dom.Text createText(org.w3c.dom.Document d,
                                          java.lang.String text)
        Creates a text node in an XML document
        Parameters:
        d - the "mother" document of the created text node
        text - contents of the text node
        Returns:
        a new text node

      • createElement

        public static org.w3c.dom.Element createElement(org.w3c.dom.Document d,
                                                java.lang.String name,
                                                java.lang.String value,
                                                boolean isCDATA)
        Creates a DOM element node with the given name and contents. If indicated the contents is enclosed in CDATA marks.
        Parameters:
        d - the "mother" document of the created Element
        name - the name of the element
        value - the element's value
        isCDATA - a flag indicating if this element contains (unformatted) CDATA.
        Returns:
        a new DOM Element

      • createElementLn

        public static org.w3c.dom.Element createElementLn(org.w3c.dom.Document d,
                                                  java.lang.String name,
                                                  java.lang.String value,
                                                  boolean isCDATA)
        Creates a DOM element node with the given name and contents. If indicated the contents is enclosed in CDATA marks. The tag ends with a new line character.
        Parameters:
        d - the "mother" document of the created Element
        name - the name of the element
        value - the element's value
        isCDATA - a flag indicating if this element contains (unformatted) CDATA.
        Returns:
        a new DOM Element

      • createTextLn

        public static org.w3c.dom.Text createTextLn(org.w3c.dom.Document d,
                                            java.lang.String text)
        Creates a text node in an XML document ended by a new line character
        Parameters:
        d - the "mother" document of the created text node
        text - contents of the text node
        Returns:
        a new text node

      • createTextLn

        public static org.w3c.dom.Text createTextLn(org.w3c.dom.Document d)
        Creates a text node in an XML document representing a new line character
        Parameters:
        d - the "mother" document of the created text node
        Returns:
        a text node containing a single newline character

      • createCDATA

        public static org.w3c.dom.CDATASection createCDATA(org.w3c.dom.Document d,
                                                   java.lang.String text)
        Creates a CDATA section node in an XML document
        Parameters:
        d - the "mother" document of the created text node
        text - the text this CDATA section contains
        Returns:
        a new CDATA section node.

      • createDocument

        public static org.w3c.dom.Document createDocument()
        Creates a new DOM document.
        Returns:
        a new empty DOM document

      • serializeDocument

        public static void serializeDocument(org.w3c.dom.Document document,
                                     java.io.Writer out)
        Saves a DOM tree as XML file
        Parameters:
        document - Document: The DOM-Tree to be saved
        out: - Writer: The (file)writer to be used

      • addElement

        public static void addElement(org.w3c.dom.Document document,
                              org.w3c.dom.Element father,
                              java.lang.String name,
                              java.lang.String attOneName,
                              java.lang.String attOneValue)
        adds an Element with one attribut to a DOM-tree.
        Parameters:
        document - Document: the DOM-tree to add to
        father - Element: the new element will be inserted directly under this Element in the tree
        name - String: the name of the new element
        attOneName - String: the name of the attribut
        attOneValue - String: the value of the attribut

      • addElement

        public static void addElement(org.w3c.dom.Document document,
                              org.w3c.dom.Element father,
                              java.lang.String name,
                              java.lang.String attOneName,
                              java.lang.String attOneValue,
                              java.lang.String attTwoName,
                              java.lang.String attTwoValue)
        adds an Element with two attributs to a DOM-tree.
        Parameters:
        document - Document: the DOM-tree to add to
        father - Element: the new element will be inserted directly under this Element in the tree
        name - String: the name of the new element
        attOneName - String: the name of the 1st attribut
        attOneValue - String: the value of the 1st attribut
        attTwoName - String: the name of the 2nd attribut
        attTwoValue - String: the value of the 2nd attribut

      • applyXSL

        public static void applyXSL(java.io.File xmlFile,
                            java.io.File xslFile,
                            java.lang.String outputFilename)
        Transforms an xml-file (xmlFilename) using an xsl-file (xslFilename) and writes the output into file (outputFilename).
        Parameters:
        xmlFile - File: the xml-source-file to be transformed
        xslFile - File: the xsl-file with the transformation rules
        outputFilename - String: the name of the file the result will be written to
